abstract.p: New Jersey, seeking to attract $35 million more from US Housing and Urban Development Department, grants $33 million to Camden to replace high-rise public housing project with 523 homes and garden apartments (S)

block.p: The state is granting $33 million toward replacing a high-rise public housing project in Camden with homes and apartments. The money, from the state Department of Community Affairs, would be used to demolish Westfield Acres, a substandard public housing project in a blighted neighborhood, and replace it with 523 homes and garden apartments, Jane M. Kenny, community affairs commissioner, announced last week. The hope is to attract $35 million more from the federal Housing and Urban Development department, which has twice turned down the Camden Housing Authority's request for funding.
